label: Startling or Open-ended Questions
helpText: Ask provocative questions at the start of the class to engage students and stimulate discussion.

label: Quotes
helpText: Present a relevant quote and ask students to interpret or discuss its significance to the lesson.

label: Storytelling
helpText: Engage students by narrating a story related to the lesson content.

label: Rhymes
helpText: Use rhymes to introduce new concepts or review existing knowledge in a fun way.

label: Analogies
helpText: Draw analogies to help students connect new concepts with what they already know.

label: Humor/Jokes
helpText: Use humor to grab students' attention and make learning more enjoyable.

label: Riddles
helpText: Present riddles related to the lesson to encourage critical thinking.

label: Visual Aids
helpText: Use pictures, charts, or graphs to assess students' understanding visually.

label: Puzzles
helpText: Engage students with puzzles that challenge their understanding of the lesson material.

label: Mystery
helpText: Create a sense of mystery or suspense to draw students into the lesson.

label: Audio
helpText: Play music, songs, or sounds and ask students to reflect or react to what they hear.

label: Games
helpText: Use classroom games to review and assess students' prior knowledge.

label: Demonstrations
helpText: Perform teacher-led demonstrations to review key concepts with students.

label: Role Play
helpText: Have students act out scenarios related to the lesson to assess their understanding.

label: Challenge
helpText: Issue a challenge to students at the start of the lesson to engage them.

label: Props/Objects
helpText: Use tangible items to engage students and assess their prior knowledge.

label: Feely Boxes
helpText: Use boxes with hidden objects to stimulate curiosity and engage students.

label: Brainstorming
helpText: Conduct group brainstorming sessions to review or gather ideas.

label: Concept Mapping
helpText: Create concept maps together in class to visually organize ideas.

label: Surveys/Polls
helpText: Use quick surveys or polls to gauge students' understanding at the start of the lesson.

label: Puppetry
helpText: Use puppets to introduce or review content in a creative and engaging way.

label: Movie Clips
helpText: Show short movie clips to introduce or reinforce lesson content.

label: Movement/Dance
helpText: Incorporate movement or dance to energize students and prepare them for the lesson.

label: Pictures
helpText: Use images to prompt discussion or review lesson content.

label: Maps
helpText: Review geographical or concept maps to assess students' understanding.

label: News/Newspaper Clippings
helpText: Discuss relevant news articles or clippings related to the lesson topic.
